intro: Taralea reticulata, commonly known as the reticulated taralea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
